intro: Atriplex dealbata, commonly known as silverleaf chenopod, is a shrub native to the arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, white hairs that help reduce water loss in harsh environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are succulent and can store water, making it well-adapted to dry conditions. Atriplex dealbata is often found in sandy soils and is a common component of shrubland and woodland ecosystems.
